column4: Can someone tell me how I can boot Hamachi at start-up, or tell me how to write a script for it? I have to run 'sudo tuncfg,' 'hamachi start,' and 'hamachi login'
look in the menu > system > preferences > session  3rd tab , you can add it there
I can add all of those commands?
you can add programs to load at startup ,  and you can also have them iwth options ,  that's as much as I know
